page.title: 10Tourism in Stamford Bridge
page.content: Visitors come to our village to see the battle site and to be in the countryside where it is peaceful and quiet.The caravan site has a shop,toilets and trees around the Caravans.There is boating on the river Derwent which flows past the picnic site.People swim under the bridge.They have fishing competitions to see who can catch the most or the heaviest fish.Lots of people come to village at the weekend.It is very busy with cars trying to park.Coaches come on trips to the coast and stop here for picnics.Cars and caravans come on weekend holidays.People go to the shallows area beside the Corn Mill and feed the ducks.Sweets, food and refreshment shops are full.Lots of people buy fish and chips for their lunch.The village is very busy in the summer.
